result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale E Verdine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No Contact provision of bond has been cancelled.
43

9:39 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant.  Statement by ADA - only requesting restitution for out of pocket expenses.  Defendant will accept the offer.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts offer.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as a repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 2 as charged and orders count 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 1 & 2 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 24 months 

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs
-AODA and any follow-up
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Count 2 only - 30 days county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court orders the $50 be applied to the fine and costs.

Court adjourned at 9:50 a.m.
Status hearing at 11-17-2015 09:15 am

9:29 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by ADA - not sure if offer will be accepted.  Statement by defendant - will accept offer.  Statement by ADA - restitution has changed and requests restitution be capped at out of pocket expenses.  Statement by defendant - will accept.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  ADA recites offer, upon plea to count 1 & 2 as charged, will dismiss and read-in count 3.  Statement by defendant regarding domestic part of count 1 and requests to talk with an attorney.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 17, 2015 at 9:15 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 9:35 a.m.
Summary of Restitution (AMENDED) w/attachments - $21,699.71
Summary of Restitution w/attachments - $3,039.05
Status hearing at 11-03-2015 09:15 am

9:40 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will not be getting an attorney and requests to talk with the District attorney.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court sets for Status Hearing on November 3, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.  Defendant to make appointment with ther DA's office.

Court adjourned at 9:41 a.m.
